item.title: Others living north of the Orange River
item.summary: Concerning certain Kafirs from the northern side of the Orange River. (L VIII.27. 8387-8390). The black people ('Kafirs') in |han≠kass'o's country live to the north (or the 'other side') of the Orange River. He calls them 'Kaal Kafirs' and describes some of their customs and doings.
item.comments: 1) p.8387v: the black people eat locusts and use nets, 2) p.8388v: the name for the 'passage' between the upper front teeth (used by |han≠kass'o's mother |xabbi-an), 3) This story is found in Book VIII-27
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
